intro: Moraea nubigena, commonly known as the cloudland moraea, is a striking perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically blooms in spring and is adapted to grow in well-drained, sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
